titles.en: Chapter 70 – The Trio (of grains) and Al-Ihsa’a (Flour with oil)

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/147)

parts.text: أَحْمَدَ بْنِ هَارُونَ بْنِ مُوَفَّقٍ الْمَدِينِيِّ

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ هَارُونَ بْنِ مُوَفَّقٍ الْمَدِينِيِّ عَنْ أَبِيهِ قَالَ

text: بَعَثَ إِلَيَّ الْمَاضِي ( عليه السلام ) يَوْماً فَأَكَلْتُ عِنْدَهُ وَ أَكْثَرَ مِنَ الْحَلْوَاءِ فَقُلْتُ مَا أَكْثَرَ هَذِهِ الْحَلْوَاءَ فَقَالَ ( عليه السلام ) إِنَّا وَ شِيعَتَنَا خُلِقْنَا مِنَ الْحَلَاوَةِ فَنَحْنُ نُحِبُّ الْحَلْوَاءَ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Ahmad Bin Haroun Bin Mowafaq Al Madainy, form his father who said,

‘One day Al-Maazy<sup>asws</sup> (7th Imam<sup>asws</sup>) sent for me, so I ate in his<sup>asws</sup> presence, and most of it was sweet dishes. So I said, ‘How abundant are these sweets!’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘We<sup>asws</sup> and our<sup>asws</sup> Shias have both been Created from the sweetness, so we love the sweets’.
en.sarwar: 1. A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad from Ahmad ibn Harun ibn Muwaffaq al-Madiniy from his father who has said the following: “Once al-Madiy (the previous) abu al-Hassan ‘Alayhi al-Salam, called me for food and I ate food with him. He (the Imam) ate quite a bit of al-Halwa’ (sweet) and I said, ‘This is quite a bit of al-HalwaY He (the Imam) said, ‘I and our followers are created from sweetness; thus we like sweet.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (22/147)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: مَنْ لَمْ يُرِدْ مِنَّا الْحَلْوَاءَ أَرَادَ الشَّرَابَ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Abu Hamza, from Abu Baseer,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The one who does not want (to eat) the sweet dishes from us, wants the (sweet) drinks’.
en.sarwar: 2. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn abu Hamzah from abu Basir who has said the following: “If one of us does not want al-Halwa’ he wants drink (which is sweet).”’

narrator_chain.text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ يَعْقُوبَ عَنْ عَبْدِ الْأَعْلَى قَالَ

text: أَكَلْتُ مَعَ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَوْماً فَأُتِيَ بِدَجَاجَةٍ مَحْشُوَّةٍ خَبِيصاً فَفَكَكْنَاهَا وَ أَكَلْنَاهَا .
ابْنُ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ يَعْقُوبَ عَنْ عَبْدِ الْأَعْلَى قَالَ أَكَلْتُ مَعَ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) مِثْلَ الْخَبَرِ الْأَوَّلِ .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Fazzal, from Yunus Bin Yunua Bin Yaqoub, from Abdul A’ala who said,
‘One day I ate with Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, so I was brought a stuffed grilled chicken, so we took it apart and ate it’.
Ibn Fazal, from Yunus Bin Yaqoub, from Abdul A’ala who said,
‘I ate with Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>’ – like the first Hadeeth.
en.sarwar: 3. Ahmad ibn Muhammad has narrated from ibn Faddal from Yunus ibn Ya’qub from ‘Abd al-‘A’la’ who has said the following: “I once ate with abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, a chicken filled with Khabis (a sweet made of bread and dates). We opened and ate it.” “Ibn Faddal has narrated from Yunus ibn Ya‘qub from ‘Abd al-‘A’la’ who has said that he ate with abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, like what is mentioned in the previous Hadith.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (22/148)

narrator_chain.text: ابْنُ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ يَعْقُوبَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: كُنَّا بِالْمَدِينَةِ فَأَرْسَلَ إِلَيْنَا اصْنَعُوا لَنَا فَالُوذَجَ وَ أَقِلُّوا فَأَرْسَلْنَا إِلَيْهِ فِي قَصْعَةٍ صَغِيرَةٍ .

en.hubeali: Ibn Fazzal, from Yunus Bin Yaqoub,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws, said, ‘We were at Al-Medina, so heasws sent a message to us to make Falouzaj (a sweet drink) for himasws, and make only a little. So we sent it over to himasws in a small bowl’.
en.sarwar: 4. Ibn Faddal has narrated from Yunus ibn Ya’qub who has said the following: “We were in al-Madinah and abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, sent a message to us to make for him (the Imam) Faludah (a kind of sweet) of a little quantity . We then sent it to him (the Imam) in a small bowl.’”
